summary: U.S. assistance to Micronesia, the Marshall Islands, and Palau provides as much as one-third of the countries' annual budgets. This includes grants—for things like health care and education—that will end in 2023 or 2024, so the U.S. also contributes to trust funds meant to partly replace them. However, we project that Micronesia's and the Marshall Islands' trust funds will supply less funding than the grants...
title: Compacts of Free Association: Implications of Planned Ending of Some U.S. Economic Assistance
